data.title: Great Cajun
data.text:
We love Cajun/Creole food.
Lee Esthers is a really good place to enjoy it.
Lee Esthers is the kind of place you hope you find when you are out on the road. We were in early and there was no wait. The server was a sweetheart.
My wife opted for the Louisiana Cajun Bowl with white rice, it was flavorful and filled with smoked chicken, brisket, pork, and sausage with their spicy secret sauce. Not to mention the side of jalapeno potato salad. Too good.
I had Crawfish etouffe. I opted for “sort of spicy “, but alas, it was a bit too spicy for this old man. Nonetheless it was delightful. The etouffe was filled with Louisiana crawfish and Tasso ham with a roux and that spicy sauce.
If you are in the Palmdale area don’t miss Lee Esthers. 
My only real question about Lee Esthers is why isn’t there something like it at home?

data.title: Authentic...with a wait.
data.text: Great food. Very authentic and delish.  This place is a delight. If you want excellent, authentic cajun. Here it is. Visit the "secret menu" on their website.  3 people for lunch.  $48 not including tip.  However...don't go if you're in a hurry.  The staff is super nice. But the wait for the food can be painful.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: After a visit to New Orleans, we were so excited to find a place that has authentic Creole food. The prices are reasonable, but it took awhile to get the food ( a to go order). The good was delicious. Portion sizes aren't huge, but it's reflected in the price. The restaurant itself is a little hole in the wall, but sometimes the best places are the most unseemly. We definitely want to try it again, but just haven't made it back yet.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Very good. Decent prices. Go on a Saturday for their "hobo bag". Similar to boiling crab or hot n juicy crawling without having to go too far.

data.title: Great.... Sometimes
data.text:
I have tried many times to come with an  open mind because the food is good. But when you have to make up excuses for an establishment, its not going to make it.
Service inside: it is small and cramped and you often have to deal with the attitudes of the waitstaff and long wait times from the kitchen. I understand about cooking  fresh and all of that but over an over?! Ive had to leave without my food because it takes that long. ( over an hour for lunch) I tried To Go orders.. Nope come in the restaurant and they knew my order but it wasn't taken properly so I was only to receive half an order and I was told to pay and then I was told that my order still wasn't ready. After being told it would be a 30min wait and even gave them a little extra time. 5 strikes your out! 

The food is usually really good.... If you ever get it!

data.title: The Best!!!
data.text: The best! Especially the Gumbo which is only made on certain days of the week. Takes a little time to prepare food so go before your hungry to order in or call in advance for take out but well worth the wait.

data.title: Great experience
data.text: In Palmdale for business. The girl at the desk at our hotel recommended Lee Esther's but we'd already seen it on TripAdvisor.  We got there pretty early in the evening. It's a small place but we were seated immediately. Our waitress was so helpful. A real sweetie. We ordered the catfish with boudin balls and greens.  The catfish was nice & crispy. The boudin balls were wonderful and the greens just OK.  We finished off our meal with peach cobbler & ice cream.  Yummy! The waitress brought out the young woman who makes the cobbler for us to meet.  Such a nice experience.  If we ever find ourselves in Palmdale again, we'll definitely come back.

data.title: Great foodskightky pricey and takes time
data.text: First, food is really good! Really Really Really Good! However it dose take a while to get your order and it dose cost a bit. Yes of course you get what you pay for and good things take time.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Great food and great service i would recommend this place very highly u will not be disappointed  this place is small it is always full

data.title: French Quarter Cuisine In Palmdale
data.text: You don't have to go to New Orleans to enjoy great Creole and Cajun cuisine. This distinct gastronomic experience is available here in Palmdale, CA, just a short drive north of Los Angeles. This may be a relatively small place but the service is very good, staff friendly, and servings are ample for enjoyment and satisfaction. First time at this location or first time with the type of food, one should ask about their menu. They did a cook out in a park for our church some years ago and served more than a hundred hungry people who left well-fed, very satisfied and offered generous compliments. I like everything in their menu but prefer mild to medium spice level. Try their gumbo and jambalaya...these are dreamy-craving items for me! I am waiting for the right occasion to place a catering service order. As trite as it may sound, Bon Appetit here in Palmdale!

data.title: Great Jambalaya
data.text: Jambalaya shrimp and chicken was great.  Jambalaya is a Louisiana Creole dish of Spanish and French influence. It consists of meat and vegetables mixed with rice.  Restaurant has no alcohol.  It is small, but great food.

data.title: Yes - Yes ~ Yes
data.text:
I do eat out a lot and one of the questions I dread is "Is your food tasting good?"  You hate to say it's average at best. 
However Lee Esters food tastes fabulous and delicious. It is kind of weird to get to from Lancaster however worth the search. I will return again and again 😍.

data.title: Down home   'Nor lens authentic home cooking.......
data.text: Even though it is smaller double store front restaurant, don't let that fool ya. The billoffare is a grand flavor of adventure to the cuisine of the bayou's of southern Louisiana.My personal favorite is a  "Rib Dog" a filleted beef rib in a bun with fried onions and green peppers. Which is followed by a warm piece of peach cobbler under a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Washed down by a cream soda. Bon Appetite.

data.title: Authentic Creole Cooking
data.text:
The restaurant may be small; but the food and the friendly service are fabulous.
My husband always orders the Jambalaya.   I order off the "secret" menu and get the seafood with 2 sides.   When you go you MUST order the Bouden Balls.  I probably didn't spell that correctly.  Just order them.  All it takes is one visit and you will be coming back on a regular basis too.

data.title: Loved this place!
data.text:
As you enter Lee Esther's the wonderful aroma is the first thing that greets you. Then the  waitresses make you feel right at home and help you decide what to order. My husband had the special of the day......Gumbo.  It was filled with tasty delights.  I ordered the lunch special, Jambalaya.  Both were excellent choices.  Side of red beans added to the terrific flavors. Even though we were full, we ordered the peach cobbler with ice cream to share and shamefully took home an order of four beignets......which we thought were better than ones in New Orleans. 
Everyone from owner to people in the kitchen were friendly, happy and welcoming.
Like others, we will be back next time we are in Palmdale!

data.title: Truly amazing food
data.text:
As a European...this food is truly outstanding....not fine dining ....but magnificent flavours....and lots of it...Good selection....All "home" cooked...spiced to suit your taste.
Inexpensive..

Basic cafe style layout...

Going back again tomorrow...

data.title: Great homestyle cooking
data.text: We keep going back to try something else on the menu.  The waitresses are friendly and very helpful with explaining the menu.  Wonderful Cajun cooking.

data.title: The best place in town
data.text: My wife and I have had about every thing on the menu every thing I've had is great it's not a fast food restaurant it is fresh and cooked to order like Europe it's real Louisiana food  its not the hot food they call Louisiana food with no flavor my wife's family are from Louisiana make sure to get there early because he can run out of the good stuff before 2:00 pm if your tacking out make sure every thing in your bag just saying

data.title: Palmdale Has Soulfood
data.text: I visited this place on Saturday with 8 girlfriends. The place is small but the food was fantastic. They do not take reservations, however I called one hour ahead and they set up tables for us. I I had the crab boil with extra shrimp and spicy. I must say this dish was sooooo good that I was licking my fingers. The corn was sweet with a spicy taste buried in the bottom of the bowl and I could not put it down.  The juice was dribbling down my chin  and I did not care . The portion sizes are very large. I will come here again and try other dishes. A great find in Palmdale.

data.title: Louisiana Home-Style Cooking
data.text: I've been to Lee Esther's several times and have tried a different dish each time.  It has never been a disappointment.  Today I had one of my own personal favorites, Shrimp N' Grits.  Again, it was not a disappointment.  Generous portions and great flavor.  Someone came up and asked me what I was eating because it smelled so good.  They asked for the number too.  Will be going back for more.  A little place with a big, authentic Louisiana punch!
